items.title: VI Live: Fortuna slaat in de slotfase toe tegen AZ in doelpuntenfestijn
items.summary: Naast de duels van PSV en Feyenoord die we in een apart liveblog volgen, staan er nog drie Eredivisie-duels op het programma. Daarnaast wordt er ook volop gevoetbald in het buitenland. In deze VI Live blijf je daarvan volledig op de hoogte.

items.title: Hearts bereikt fraaie mijlpaal en houdt zwalkend Celtic op afstand
items.summary: Heart of Midlothian gaat met een heel lekker gevoel het nieuwe jaar in. De verrassende koploper van Schotland heeft door een 2-0-zege op Rangers namelijk de koppositie verder verstevigd √©n een nieuw record gepakt.

items.title: Aston Villa v Manchester United: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 4.30pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Table | Follow us on Bluesky | Email Tim 2 min United win a throw-in on the right, and then a free kick, which comes to nothing. We have a minor celebrity in the tunnel! Kelly Osbourne, daughter of the late lamented Ozzy, is there and she‚Äôs wearing a Villa shirt. Is she playing? No, her son Sid is a mascot today. He‚Äôs not holding hands with John McGinn in the traditional fashion ‚Äì he‚Äôs in his arms. Continue reading...

items.title: London City Lionesses sack manager Precheur
items.summary: London City Lionesses sack manager Jocelyn Precheur midway through their debut season in the Women's Super League.

items.title: Sources: Liverpool fear 'significant' Isak injury
items.summary: Sources have told ESPN that Liverpool fear Alexander Isak's injury may be significant.

items.title: Mbapp√© equals Ronaldo record, hits 'Siu' celeb
items.summary: Kylian Mbapp√© added his name to another line in the record books on Saturday, tying Cristiano Ronaldo for the most goals by a Real Madrid player in a calendar year.

items.title: USA's Pepi scores again in PSV comeback win
items.summary: United States forward Ricardo Pepi continued his excellent run of form with a goal that helped PSV Eindhoven beat Utrecht 2-1 on Sunday.

items.title: Premier League live updates: Man United travel to Aston Villa
Aston Villa couldn't be crowned Premier League champions, could they?
items.summary: Aston Villa started poorly, but they're now in the running for the Premier League title.

items.title: De Jong viert basisrentree bij Bar√ßa met belangrijke zege op Villarreal
Van Polen benoemt mogelijke oorzaak voor 'domme' rode kaart Valente
items.summary: Voor Luciano Valente eindigde de laatste wedstrijd van 2025 al voor het laatste fluitsignaal. De revelatie van de eerste seizoenshelft bij Feyenoord pakte twee keer geel tegen FC Twente. Analyticus Bram van Polen was niet te spreken over de actie van de middenvelder.

items.title: Ekitike's chance to become Reds' first-choice No 9 with Isak set to miss key games
Wanneer is het seizoen nog geslaagd voor Feyenoord en Van Persie?
items.summary: Voor Feyenoord is het seizoen geslaagd als het zich verzekert van de Champions League, aldus Robin van Persie. De trainer vindt dat zijn club in de eerste seizoenshelft tegen veel uitdagingen is aangelopen.

items.title: Liverpool fear Alexander Isak sustained significant injury at Tottenham
items.summary: Striker hurt by Van de Ven tackle when opening scoring MRI scan results to reveal length of spell on sidelines Liverpool fear their record signing Alexander Isak has sustained a significant injury and is facing a lengthy period on the sidelines. The league champions are waiting on the results of an MRI scan after the ¬£125m man was injured against Tottenham in the Premier League clash on Saturday night. The 26-year-old sustained the problem while scoring the opener against Spurs ‚Äì his second league goal of an already injury-hit debut season ‚Äì in the 2-1 win after defender Micky van de Ven slid across and caught his leg as the striker planted it on the floor. Continue reading...

items.title: Chelsea put nine past Liverpool in Women's League Cup
items.summary: Chelsea hammer Liverpool 9-1 to reach the Women's League Cup semi-finals, while Manchester City, Manchester United and Arsenal also progress.

items.title: Cullen says Suljovic's behaviour is 'not darts' after defeat in feisty encounter
items.summary: Joe Cullen has responded with fury after being dumped out of the World Darts Championship by Mensur Suljovic, saying the Austrian's behaviour on stage is "not darts".

items.title: Liverpool fear significant lower leg injury for Isak
items.summary: Liverpool fear Alexander Isak has sustained a significant lower leg injury after the striker was forced off against Tottenham on Saturday.

items.title: Hearts tighten grip on Premiership top spot as Shankland strikes to down Rangers
items.summary: Rangers arrived in Edinburgh with a view to reminding onlookers they can be a key component in this season‚Äôs Scottish title race. They departed as the latest victims of the Hearts juggernaut. Back to back wins against Celtic had already been secured before Hearts repeated the trick against Rangers. Dreams of a first Hearts title since 1960 are not merely alive. They are growing. Rangers are a dozen points adrift of Derek McInnes‚Äôs team after this, a first away league defeat of 2025. Hearts are 18 games and halfway towards the promised land. Rangers had arguably been the better side before Hearts whacked them with two, decisive first-half goals. Stuart Findlay claimed the first of them, the centre back rising highest after Alexandros Kyziridis combined with Claudio Braga for a short corner. Kyziridis‚Äôs cross was pinpoint. The Greek winger had earlier threatened the Rangers goal twice, the visitors having a potential opener ruled out for an offside against Bojan Miovski. Continue reading...

items.title: Chelsea hammer dismal Liverpool 9-1 and storm into Women‚Äôs League Cup semis
items.summary: Quarter-final: Liverpool 1-9 Chelsea Rytting Kaneryd scores hat-trick as Blues run riot Humiliated, humbled and, frankly, embarrassed, it was probably a relief for Liverpool when the clock reached 90:00 and the referee Grace Lowe immediately blew the final whistle without adding any stoppage time, bringing a sympathetically early end to a chastening afternoon for the Reds, dismantled by a Chelsea side who barely needed to break sweat. It is not supposed to be this easy in a quarter-final between top-flight sides. The scoreboard read 9-1. ‚ÄúAt least it wasn‚Äôt 10,‚Äù one home fan said while trudging back to the car. The truth is, it could have been worse, had Chelsea not rather bizarrely had two set-piece goals ruled out for soft-looking fouls in the box that no Liverpool player seemed to appeal for. Continue reading...

items.title: Lightning strikes twice! Schaper wins again via play-off eagle in Mauritius
items.summary: Jayden Schaper secured his second DP World Tour title in as many weeks after a hole-out eagle at the second play-off hole saw him win the AfrAsia Bank Mauritius Open.
